title: HBO issues straight to series order for Game of Thrones prequel focusing on House Targaryen
text:
Just hours after it was revealed HBO was dropping one of its Game of Thrones prequel shows, it has issued a straight-to-series order for another prequel show.

HBO announced Tuesday that it has issued a straight-to-series 10-episode order for House of the Dragon, focusing on the origins of House Targaryen, via Variety.

Another Game of Thrones prequel project that didn't have a title, which starred Naomi Watts and already filmed a pilot over the summer, was revealed to not be going forward earlier today.

House of the Dragon: HBO announced Tuesday that it has issued a straight-to-series 10-episode order for House of the Dragon, focusing on the origins of House Targaryen, via Variety

House of the Dragon is set 300 years before the events of the original series, which wrapped up its eight-season run in May.

The series will be based on Game of Thrones author George R.R. Martin's companion book Fire & Blood, which tells the history of House Targaryen and was published in November 2018.

In Westeros lore, House Targaryen ruled over all Seven Kingdoms for centuries before Robert's Rebellion, which took place before the events of the flagship Game of Thrones series.

Companion: The series will be based on Game of Thrones author George R.R. Martin's companion book Fire & Blood, which tells the history of House Targaryen and was published in November 2018

Emilia Clarke's Daenerys Targaryen represented the last of the Targaryen name in Game of Thrones, with her ancestors to be featured in House of the Dragon.

Martin co-created the House of the Dragon series with Colony creator Ryan Condal, who will both serve as executive producers.

Game of Thrones director Miguel Sapochnik is attached to direct the pilot and subsequent episodes, while serving as co-showrunner with Condal.

Daenerys: Emilia Clarke's Daenerys Targaryen represented the last of the Targaryen name in Game of Thrones, with her ancestors to be featured in House of the Dragon

Martin, Sapochnik and Condal will serve as executive producers of House of the Dragon, alongside another Game of Thrones producer, Vince Gerardis.

'The Game of Thrones’ universe is so rich with stories,' said Casey Bloys, president of HBO programming.

'We look forward to exploring the origins of House Targaryen and the earlier days of Westeros along with Miguel, Ryan and George,' Bloys added.

Fire and Blood: Martin, Sapochnik and Condal will serve as executive producers of House of the Dragon, alongside another Game of Thrones producer, Vince Gerardis

Bloys announced the new series during a presentation for the upcoming HBO Max streaming service, that will launch in May 2020.

Just hours before the presentation, though, news surfaced that HBO will not be moving forward with another Game of Thrones prequel series, which had a pilot episode filmed in Northern Ireland over the summer starring Naomi Watts.

HBO's straight-to-series order for House of the Dragon means it will avoid a lengthy development process like the other prequel series and even the flagship series had to go through.
